column4: my mate installed XP onto a new partition of a vista computer, but then it would only boot into XP, so then he deleted the XP partition and it won't boot at all because the bootloader needs repairing. Is there any way to do this with a ubuntu live CD? (he doesn't have the vista dvd)
you can install grub, if you got a small linux partition with certgain files, and force it to boot xp/vista/ubuntu etc
he doesn't want ubuntu on the computer, I'm just wondering if I can use ubuntu (preferrably live CD) to repair the bootloader to get vista booting.
